title: Marion Barry
summary: Marion Shepilov Barry (born Marion Barry Jr.; March 6, 1936 â€“ November 23, 2014)[1] was an American politician who served as the second and fourth mayor of the District of Columbia from 1979 to 1991 and 1995 to 1999. A Democrat, Barry had served three tenures on the Council of the District of Columbia, representing as an at-large member from 1975 to 1979 and in Ward 8 from 1993 to 1995, and again from 2005 to 2014.
